subcategory: Lack of DEI Awareness among People Leaders

content.text: This refers to a situation when managers or supervisors have insufficient knowledge and understanding of the value of encouraging gender diversity in the workplace.
There is a common assumption that individuals across various levels of the organization are aware of the issues faced by females, but this is often not the case.
The agenda for DEI should be driven more by the people leaders.
Organizations need to align DEI strategies with the goals of line managers.
HR should arrange various training sessions, including unconscious bias training sessions, for people leaders.
Organizations should provide opportunities to both males and females to enhance their awareness about the challenges that females typically encounter.
